blog.name: dramaphan
blog.title: Yo I Comment On The Drama When Shit Hits The Fan
blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.

Icon by phanniephobic, header by cinnamonnutlester

summary: maybe this is me being dramatic but doesn't it feel like the phandom almost romanticizes codependency sometimes? they go places...
question: maybe this is me being dramatic but doesn't it feel like the phandom almost romanticizes codependency sometimes? they go places by themselves, they have friends of their own. not everything they do is together just because their brand is Dan and Phil. i almost get the vibe that ever since dan publicized his depression so many people think ~phil is his savior and he would never survive without him aw how cute he's dans 1 & only supportive bf~ like no its not healthy/cute to depend on one person
answer: Oh the Phandom absolutely romanticizes all kinds of shit they shouldn’t. Like, if course Dan and Phil do things on their own. They have their own interests and their own friend groups and they are two separate people. Their schedules aren’t going to match up 100% of the time. It’s not unreasonable to think that they sometimes do stuff without each other, and it’s pretty unhealthy to romanticize this idea of codependency.

reblog.comment: Oh the Phandom absolutely romanticizes all kinds of shit they shouldn’t. Like, if course Dan and Phil do things on their own. They have their own interests and their own friend groups and they are two separate people. Their schedules aren’t going to match up 100% of the time. It’s not unreasonable to think that they sometimes do stuff without each other, and it’s pretty unhealthy to romanticize this idea of codependency.

They have their own interests and their own friend groups and they are two separate people. Their schedules aren’t going to match up 100% of the time. It’s not unreasonable to think that they sometimes do stuff without each other, and it’s pretty unhealthy to romanticize this idea of codependency.
trail.content: Oh the Phandom absolutely romanticizes all kinds of shit they shouldn’t. Like, if course Dan and Phil do things on their own. They have their own interests and their own friend groups and they are two separate people. Their schedules aren’t going to match up 100% of the time. It’s not unreasonable to think that they sometimes do stuff without each other, and it’s pretty unhealthy to romanticize this idea of codependency.

blog.name: thedemonphanti
blog.title: thedemonphanti
blog.description: Treat People With Respect | Unpopular Opinions Welcome

summary: Newsflash: Dan and Phil are partners, which means they make decisions together (even the ones you don’t like)
body:
Newsflash: Dan and Phil are partners, which means they make decisions together (even the ones you don’t like)

I posted something similar in a reblog, but have heard enough people saying that the DAPG hiatus was a unilateral decision made by Dan that I wanted to make a separate post to say that there is no evidence to support that theory. I might be more inclined to believe it if the timing coincided, but Dan stopped posting videos on DINOF over a half a year prior to the DAPG hiatus. I know the phandom has a tendency to paint Dan as the bad guy and Phil as an innocent bystander, but they are business partners and best friends and if they didn’t have an effective way of discussing things and making decisions together, neither of those relationships would have lasted for this long. Most of the evidence we have, especially the fact that they said as much at the first Interactive Introverts show, before taking it out because it upset people, points to the fact that Dan and Phil have been wanting to focus on their solo channels/projects for a while now. Even if Dan decided he no longer wanted to do YouTube, I highly doubt he would be so cavalier about something that would have such a big impact on Phil to just up and quit on a whim. The most likely scenario is that they had been planning this for quite some time and made these decisions together and the phandom should learn to accept that and not try to scapegoat one or the other.

summary: In A World Unlike Our Own
title: In A World Unlike Our Own
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2Gu0B8f

by Swimmerkoko8014

Phil Lester has been raised on the basis that he should never trust people from the Outside. They are rotten, no good liars who would betray their own mothers. His safe life in the water kingdom has never given Phil any reason to doubt that philosophy. So, for all twenty years of his life, he’s thought horrible and vicious thoughts towards the Outside people. This all changes when he stumbles across a badly wounded Outside boy, Daniel Howell, not that much younger than him. For better or worse, Dan worms his way through Phil’s rock-hard defenses he’s built against Outsiders. Phil learns that most Outsiders are just like he has been taught, and that Dan escaped, wanting a new life. Will Phil be able to protect his new friend? Or will Dan be re-claimed by the dark forces he fought so hard to escape

Words: 355, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Phandom/The Fantastic Foursome (YouTube RPF)
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence
  • Categories: F/F, F/M, M/M
  • Characters: Dan Howell, Phil Lester, Louise Pentland, Original Characters, Phil Lester’s Family
  • Relationships: Dan Howell/Phil Lester, Original Character(s)/Original Character(s), Dan Howell & Original Character(s), Phil Lester & Original Character(s), Dan Howell & Phil Lester & Louise Pentland
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Magic, Alternate Universe - Fantasy, Magic, Angst, Past Sexual Assault, Past Abuse, Oblivious Phil Lester, Oblivious Dan Howell, Mutual Pining, Pining Dan Howell, Pining Phil Lester, Protective Phil, Hurt Dan Howell, BAMF Louise Pentland, why is that not a tag wtf, BAMF Phil Lester, BAMF Dan Howell, but not till later hehe, Slow Burn, Like really slow, i love my original characters, they won’t block the ship don’t worry, i will add more tags as this goes on

by Swimmerkoko8014

Phil Lester has been raised on the basis that he should never trust people from the Outside. They are rotten, no good liars who would betray their own mothers. His safe life in the water kingdom has never given Phil any reason to doubt that philosophy. So, for all twenty years of his life, he’s thought horrible and vicious thoughts towards the Outside people. This all changes when he stumbles across a badly wounded Outside boy, Daniel Howell, not that much younger than him. For better or worse, Dan worms his way through Phil’s rock-hard defenses he’s built against Outsiders. Phil learns that most Outsiders are just like he has been taught, and that Dan escaped, wanting a new life. Will Phil be able to protect his new friend? Or will Dan be re-claimed by the dark forces he fought so hard to escape
